tx_finedge-solutions_260115-discover.title: Untitled Meeting

I.

Thing I have more questions. But one thing I would just note is the way that our pricing works in general. So you would be able to have, you know, every person in your company can get the DocuSign if on kind of whatever AutomateFlow plan you guys end up going with or whatever sort of plan ends up making sense? Could you talk to me a bit about? Are you thinking at all about this more broadly across the HR function? So like for example, we often see customers who James use this in recruiting phases of the process to filter out like candidates that aren't real James have customers who James use it to monitor all of the TeamChat communications and proactively flag if you have risks of attrition, like those types of things that customers do. I want to be super clear, the use case you laid out the hibob to DocuSign that's super easy. 100 percent is within the wheelhouse of AutomateFlow. activityLog.description: Discovery call with Theodoros (Head of IT) and Lior (IT Manager). Initial use case: HiBob → DocuSign for employee contracts (~100/year). Low volume, simple integration. They're also evaluating n8n but leaning AutomateFlow for EU compliance. DocuSign contract not finalized yet—targeting end of Jan. Follow-up scheduled Feb 11. Sending use case decks for HR and RevOps to seed expansion conversation.

tasks.prompt: Analyze the current state of this deal. Identify key risks, recommend next steps, and assess the likelihood of closing. Consider all available information.
Summarize this call. Identify key commitments made, objections raised, and action items. Assess the stakeholder sentiment.
Draft a follow-up email based on the recent interactions. The email should advance the deal, address any concerns raised, and include clear next steps.
